document.docTitle: Sesieutes zhui Zhang & Fu, 2011, new species
document.masterDocTitle: FIRST REPORT OF THE GENUS SESIEUTES SIMON (ARANEAE: LIOCRANIDAE) FROM CHINA, WITH DESCRIPTION OF ONE NEW SPECIES

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: FIRST REPORT OF THE GENUS SESIEUTES SIMON (ARANEAE: LIOCRANIDAE) FROM CHINA, WITH DESCRIPTION OF ONE NEW SPECIES

figureCitation.captionText-0: Figures 1 - 9. Sesieutes zhui sp. nov 1. Male body, dorsal view. 2. Male abdomen, ventral view. 3. Carapace and chelicerae of male, front view, showing clypeal lobe and lateral condyle. 4. Eye region of male, dorsal view. 5. Left chelicerae of male, posterior view. 6. Endites, labium and sternum of male, ventral view, showing granulations. 7. Tibia, metatarsus and tarsus of male right leg I, showing spines. 8. Male femur I, dorsoprolateral view, showing two strong spines. 9. Male femur I, showing larger spines. CL = clypeal lobe; DS = dosal scutum; ES = epigastric scutum; LC = lateral condyle; MI = muscle impression; P = pits; PS = prolateral spine; TG = thoracic groove. Scale bars: 1 – 3, 6 – 8, 1 mm; 4 and 9, 0.5 mm; 5, 0.7 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Figures 10 - 15. Sesieutes zhui sp. nov. 10. Epigynum, ventral view. 11. Vulva, dorsal view. 12. Left male palp, prolateral view. 13. Left male palp, ventral view. 14. Left male palp, retrolateral view. 15. Left palp, dorsal view, showing tibial apophyses and fine hairs of cymbium. C = conductor; CH = cymbium hairs; CD = copulatory duct; CO = copulatory opening; E = embolus; FD = fertilization duct; T = tegulum; SD = sperm duct; ST = subtegulum; dRTA = distal retrolateral tibial apophysis; pRTA = proximal retrolateral tibial apophysis; S = spermathecae. Scale bars: 10 - 15, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type Data: Holotype male and one female paratype , from Xishuangbanna Dai Autonomous Prefecture ( 21.08°N , 99.56°E ), Yunnan Province , China ,
23 October 1986
( MHBU ), collected by M. S. Zhu
.

Other type materials:
Thailand , Chiang Mai Province , Chomthong District , Doi Inthanon National Park , Doi [Mt.] Inthanon , evergreen hill forest,
1600-1650 m
, extraction of soil sample, 1 male and 1 juvenile ,
11 January 2006
;
1 female , pitfall trap,
25 March to 23 April , 2000
[ MHNG ]
;
2 males and 2 females , soil sieving,
10 September 2005
[ TNHM ]
;
1 female and 3 juveniles , soil sieving,
10 January 2005
[ MHNG ]
;
1 male , soil sieving,
9 October 1999
[ MHNG ]
;
1 male , evergreen hill forest,
1750 m
, soil sieving,
15 January 2000
[ MHNG ]. All leg. P. Dankittipakul . Diagnosis: Among its close
Sesieutes
relatives (see Deeleman-Reinhold 2001 )
, this species is very similar to
S . schwendingeri Deeleman-Reinhold, 2001
(cf. Figs. 771 - 774) in the general body shape, coloration, and shapes of the palpal bulb and epigynum, but distinguished from
S . schwendingeri
by the anterior copulatory openings ( Fig. 10 ), while situated centrally in
S . schwendingeri
; by the length of the copulatory ducts and coiling direction ( Fig. 11 ); also by the distance between the embolus tip and cymbium, nearly touching ( Fig. 14 ), while in S.
schwendingeri
obviously apart.

caption.paragraph:
Figures 1-9.
Sesieutes zhui
sp. nov 1. Male body, dorsal view. 2. Male abdomen, ventral view. 3. Carapace and chelicerae of male, front view, showing clypeal lobe and lateral condyle. 4. Eye region of male, dorsal view. 5. Left chelicerae of male, posterior view. 6. Endites, labium and sternum of male, ventral view, showing granulations. 7. Tibia, metatarsus and tarsus of male right leg I, showing spines. 8. Male femur I, dorsoprolateral view, showing two strong spines. 9. Male femur I, showing larger spines. CL = clypeal lobe; DS = dosal scutum; ES = epigastric scutum; LC = lateral condyle; MI = muscle impression; P = pits; PS = prolateral spine; TG = thoracic groove. Scale bars: 1–3, 6–8, 1 mm; 4 and 9, 0.5 mm; 5, 0.7 mm.

Figures 10-15.
Sesieutes zhui
sp. nov. 10. Epigynum, ventral view. 11. Vulva, dorsal view. 12. Left male palp, prolateral view. 13. Left male palp, ventral view. 14. Left male palp, retrolateral view. 15. Left palp, dorsal view, showing tibial apophyses and fine hairs of cymbium. C = conductor; CH = cymbium hairs; CD = copulatory duct; CO = copulatory opening; E = embolus; FD = fertilization duct; T = tegulum; SD = sperm duct; ST = subtegulum; dRTA = distal retrolateral tibial apophysis; pRTA = proximal retrolateral tibial apophysis; S = spermathecae. Scale bars: 10-15, 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female ( paratype ). Total length 6.13: cephalothorax 3.23 long, 2.26 wide; abdomen 2.90 long, 1.64 wide. Eye sizes and interdistances: AME 0.16, ALE 0.16, PME 0.11, PLE 0.13; AME – AME 0.19, AME –ALE 0.16, PME–PME 0.23, PME–PLE 0.26, ALE–PLE 0.25. MOA 0.23 long, front width 0.26 back width 0.32. Clypeus height 0.16. Eyes, endites, labium, sternum, and legs almost as in male. Carapace like male but with small granules along border. Abdomen without dorsal scutum, pattern as in male. Spination similar to male. Leg I: 8.33 (0.97+2.10+2.23+0.71+ 2.32); Leg II: 6.12 (1.02+1.61+1.87+0.68+1.94); Leg III: 5.59 (0.88+1.351.10+ 0.65+1.61); Leg IV: 8.92 (1.07+2.23+2.32+0.94+2.36). Leg formula: 4123. Epigynum as illustrated ( Figs. 10-11 ), flat plate, a little wider than long; with paired copulatory openings anteriorly, leading through long and winding sclerotized ducts into posterior spermathecae. Spermathecae nearly globose.
Etymology. The specific name is a patronym in honor of Prof. Mingsheng Zhu, who collected the holotype and one paratype specimens.

Natural History. Typically a ground-dwelling liocranid sac spider, these specimens were collected from the sunlit monsoon forest by sifting leaf litter in tropical China. The specimens of Thailand were collected from evergreen hill forest in various times of year by several methods, for example, extraction of soil sample, pitfall trap and soil sieving.
